page.description: Logs a user in using the UX Component's integrated login.

description.p: Pass in 1 to indicate that you are in step one of a login that uses two-factor authentication. This argument is ignored if the integrated login is not configured to use two-factor authentication.

discussion.p: The *[js:login()]* method submits the username and password data from the integrated login controls in a UX Component to the web application server to log a user in. If the integrated login is configured to use two-factor authentication, the *[js:login()]* method handles making the required callbacks to authenticate the user.
This method can only be used in a UX Component configured to use [integrated login] with the Alpha Anywhere security framework.

page.limitations: For use in a UX Component using Integrated Login
